data.title: Grime Dive
data.text: Fody's Is not the place you want to go if your looking to enjoy the night, if you looking for 1.50 drafts and drugs maybe. But this is not anything but a bar.

data.title: Always enjoyable and entertaining.
data.text: The food and wait staff are terrific.  Just redone, very nice atmosphere.  Live fire place, enjoy warmth while coming in from the cold.

data.title: Pub food, beer, historic setting
data.text: Don't be put off by nearby dive bars. This place is excellent. Cool historic features, outdoor dining weather permitting. Def going back.

data.title: Good for drinks and entertainment
data.text: The food at Fody's is not what you go for, you go for the drinks and the entertainment.  The music tends to be electric, not acoustic and don't plan on having a conversation while the entertainment is playing.  The ambiance is exactly what you'd expect a Tavern to be:  slightly on the dark side, bar-styled menu, ample drinks, moderate prices.

data.title: Good place for adults to have dinner
data.text: not a blue-haired crowd, but not young and rowdy usually either.  The kind of place we go with our friends, and without the kids.  Good food, great burgers - only complaint is that they put truffle oil on their tater tots.  Good selection of beer on draft, and a full bar.  Nice outside seating when the weather is nice on thier deck, though not much of a view.

data.title: Historic building from Nashua history turned into a restaurant.
data.text: Very historic building...small restaurant....made for intimate gatherings with friends. Great cozy seating in front of gas fireplace in winter. Everyone who goes here is very friendly. French Onion soup is very good.

data.title: Good burger
data.text: My wife and I went because we had read numerous reviews saying they had good burger and it was $5/off Sunday. So of course we both got burgers. They were juicing and given as ordered (not that common) and the bun seemed homemade and was some type of tasty sweet pretzel. beer was priced good and with 4 beers and 2 burgers the bill was only $40.

data.title: Simply the best Fish & Chips around
data.text: All the dishes here are great.  The owner sees to it that the chef keeps his menu fresh and revived regularly.  The execution in a small but very efficient kitchen is nearly flawless.  New England comfort foods like shepherds pie and chicken pot pie are super on a cold night, the corn jalapeño chowder is welcomed back on the menu finally.  The fish and chips give any British pub something to be jealous of. And of course they have many beers on tap and the bar is friendly and cozy.
